greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(k,m) = number of occurrences of k in the last section of the set of partitions of (10 + m).
comment: Sub-triangle of A182703 and also of A194812. Note that the sum of row k is also the number of partitions of 10. For further information see A182703 and A135010.
formula: Beginning with row k=11 each row starts with (k-11) 0's and ends with the subsequence 1, 0, 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 4, 7, 8, 12, the initial terms of A002865. - Alois P. Heinz, Feb 15 2012
example: For k = 1 and  m = 1; T(1,1) = 42 because there are 42 parts of size 1 in the last section of the set of partitions of 11, since 10 + m = 11, so a(1) = 42. For k = 2 and m = 1; T(2,1) = 15 because there are 15 parts of size 2 in the last section of the set of partitions of 11, since 10 + m = 11, so a(2) = 15.
xref: Always the sum of row k = p(10) = A000041(10) = 42.
The first (0-10) members of this family of triangles are A023531, A129186, A194702-A194709, this sequence.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 05 2012
